title: How did people get enough food in pre-historic times? - Quora

response.answer_text: For one they didn't have as many people to feed back then, both in population and in population density. For another they had a large range full of many things to eat, and they all reached peak abundance at different times. Thus no matter what there was always something to eat.

They killed and ate everything and anything literally. Any animal from rodents to birds larger game if they had enough men in the tribe to take it down. They would eat roots,bark,berries,grasses leftover kills from other animals etc. Anything that was available .
8500 BC. Agriculture is part of the Neolithic Revolution in the Middle East. Timeline of agriculture and food technology - Wikipedia
